column4: hey im totally new to ubuntu and i want to install it to, i currently have w7.. is it better for me to install ubuntu on vmware or what?
if i want to try ubuntu first time
each has advantages
vmware/virtualbox will alter your (crappy) OS less
you can use win7's partition resizer to make unpartitioned space (run your backups first) then ubuntu wil loffer to install to the free space
you'll need about 6Gb for the OS and enough space to be comfortable, then as much space as youo want for user data
ubuntu can also read and write ntfs, Windows cannot access ext4 which is the default fs in Ubuntu, despite ext4 definitions being completely available for use
30Gb is waaaay enough

you can dualboot with ubuntu, if thats what you mean?
yes, win7 will be added to grub
intel cpu's can be 64bit, amd64 just refers to ALL 64bit CPUs
